Posted By: kajillion (4/23/2011 9:05:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Strictly worse than [Shu Soldier-Farmers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shu Soldier-Farmers).   
  
It's strictly worse than many things, in fact. Like the much aforementioned [Angel of Mercy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Mercy), which has +1/+0 and flying...*for no additional cost*. Hence the "strictly," I suppose.  
  
In terms of not-strictly-speaking-but-still-better cards, Tireless Missionaries costs {3} more than [Temple Acolyte](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Temple Acolyte), which nets it a *truly massive and game-breaking +1/+0*. It is just a bit less color intensive than the recently printed [Archon of Redemption](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archon of Redemption), which has +1/+1, has flying, and synergizes well with many other cards. It is a single color, as compared to [Rhox Bodyguard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhox Bodyguard), which has exalted in exchange for its two-colored casting impossibility. *And all these are still generally considered to be pretty bad.*  
  
If Tireless Missionaries cost {2}{W}, I'm still fairly sure it wouldn't see play in Constructed, but I think it would see a goo... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

It is just a bit less color intensive than the recently printed Archon of Redemption, which has +1/+1, has flying, and synergizes well with many other cards. It is a single color, as compared to Rhox Bodyguard, which has exalted in exchange for its two-colored casting impossibility. And all these are still generally considered to be pretty bad.

If Tireless Missionaries cost {2}{W}, I'm still fairly sure it wouldn't see play in Constructed, but I think it would see a goo... (see all)

posts.post_content:
I enjoy being an advocate for cards below the curve, but this is really just sad to look at.  
It's unimpressive, overcosted, and the p/t is really distressingly below the curve.  
At ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) I would consider using it under some conditions.  
  
Comparing to [Lone Missionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lone Missionary), this card got a whopping +0/+2 and -1 life for the low, low cost of 3 mana.

Posted By: dudecow (7/9/2010 1:29:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
>>>*sooooo.. WotC thinks that +0/+2 and 1 less life bonus is worth THREE mana?!? (compared to Lone Missionary)*<<<  
R&D thinks that a Lightning Bolt and a Lava Axe both fit perfectly. +2 damage, no damage to creatures = +4 mana.  
  
It's the try to change the Angel of Mercy into a common card, since white already had too many flyers. However, I would have replaced flying with vigilance to produce a difference worth reducing the rarity.  
  
This is another prove that there is a rarity = power level correlation. And this means that mythics are there just for power creep & money reasons.
posts.html:
>>>sooooo.. WotC thinks that +0/+2 and 1 less life bonus is worth THREE mana?!? (compared to Lone Missionary)<<<
R&D thinks that a Lightning Bolt and a Lava Axe both fit perfectly. +2 damage, no damage to creatures = +4 mana.

It's the try to change the Angel of Mercy into a common card, since white already had too many flyers. However, I would have replaced flying with vigilance to produce a difference worth reducing the rarity.

This is another prove that there is a rarity = power level correlation. And this means that mythics are there just for power creep & money reasons.

posts.post_content:
@Ragamander: I was about to post basically the exact same thing.  
  
[Angel of Mercy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Mercy) and [Shu Soldier-Farmers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shu Soldier-Farmers) are surprisingly the only two strictly-better creatures.  
  
Also compare to [Staunch Defenders](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Staunch Defenders): for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)->![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) you get +1/+1 and 1 life.  
[Conclave Phalanx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conclave Phalanx) won't always gain you 3 life, but has +0/+1 and convoke.  
The comparison to [Archon of Redemption](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archon of Redemption) is not even funny, but that's a rare.  
  
It has exactly the same relationship to [Venerable Monk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venerable Monk) that [Teroh's Faithful](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teroh's Faithful) does to [Temple Acolyte](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Temple Acolyte): +![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) for +0/+1 and 1 life.  
  
Getting carried away now:  
[Lone Missionaries](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lone Missionaries) would become a ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) 2/2 for 5 life. Seems fair -- It has the same relationship to [Radiant's Dragoons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Radiant's Dragoons) that [Panther Warriors](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Panther Warriors) does to [Winding Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Winding Wurm).
